problem.markdown: >>Let's say you have one problem that calls from your existing python_lib.zip file, and you want to add a new problem that calls code from a second libraries. How can you do this? << (!) Have the import statement to refer to the second library. ( ) Set the system_path="python_lib" on your script tag to something else. (x) You can't do it without merging the libraries first. [explanation] We've seen the system_path="python_lib" attribute in one or two places around edX, but we've never seen it work. Changing that doesn't seem to let you refer to a different file. It's python_lib.zip or bust. [explanation]

multiplechoiceresponse.label: Let's say you have one problem that calls from your existing python_lib.zip file, and you want to add a new problem that calls code from a second libraries. How can you do this?

choicegroup.choice: Have the import statement to refer to the second library.
Set the system_path="python_lib" on your script tag to something else.
You can't do it without merging the libraries first.

div.p: We've seen the system_path="python_lib" attribute in one or two places around edX, but we've never seen it work. Changing that doesn't seem to let you refer to a different file. It's python_lib.zip or bust.
